items.subject: Filosofía
items.description: Las Disputaciones tusculanas (del año 44 a. C. y dirigidas a Marco Bruto) consisten en un tratado filosófico en cinco libros, compuesto en forma de conversaciones entre dos personajes, M. y A. Su tema central es cómo alcanzar la felicidad y la serenidad, y puesto que no se trata de una obra fácil, afronta con valor los mayores obstáculos para la consecución de este fin. El propio Cicerón nos ofrece un esquema de la obra en el prólogo a Sobre la adivinación: «las Disputaciones tusculanas […] trataban de los fundamentos de la vida feliz, la primera sobre el desprecio de la muerte, la segunda sobre soportar el dolor, la tercera sobre mitigar el dolor, la cuarta sobre las perturbaciones psicológicas y la quinta sobre la corona de toda la filosofía, la afirmación (estoica) de que la virtud es en sí misma suficiente para la vida feliz.» La obra posee la fuerza de lo íntimamente sentido, y tiene un trasfondo biográfico: fue escrita al año de la muerte de su amada hija Tulia, que sumió a Cicerón en una profunda tristeza. En sus últimos tres años se apartó de la vida política y se recluyó en su villa de Túsculo, donde se consagró a la creación literaria; éste es el más personal de los escritos de esta época.
items.title: Marco Tulio Cicerón Disputaciones Tusculanas

items.subject: Filosofía
items.description: Al comenzar el verano del 44 a. C. Cicerón sufría en sus propias carnes la agitada situación de Roma A comienzos de año había soportado como una pesada losa su exclusión de la vida política por culpa del imparable ascenso del poder personal de César tras la Guerra Civil y la subsiguiente degradación de la vieja República. El 15 de marzo fue una fecha clave, con el asesinato de este a manos de unos senadores conjurados. En Cicerón nació la esperanza de que podía abrirse un período de nuevas oportunidades, pero pronto comprobó que no era así. Se produjo una situación de caos e incertidumbre. Se proclamó una amnistía y Bruto y Casio dejaron Roma, aun ocupando el cargo de pretores, mientras que Marco Antonio permanecía como cónsul. Todo se había trastornado: la falta de programa político de los conjurados generó una notable inestabilidad y Marco Antonio mantuvo la línea de acción política del asesinado dictador, permitiendo que grupos armados de sus partidarios actuaran en la Ciudad. En abril siguiente Octaviano, el sobrino nieto adoptado por César y futuro Augusto, regresó apresuradamente a Roma y polarizó la situación entre sus partidarios y los de Antonio. Cicerón vio en este último y en sus medidas cada vez más radicales al enemigo real que debería haber perecido junto con el dictador. estriba  de los deberes a los cuales cada hombre debe atenerse en cuanto miembro del Estado (status)

Semester - Wednesdays from 10 to 12 AM – THE FINAL SEMESTER 1) 02/21/90 – Tape 1 – Side A (Approx 46 minutes) Song: The Smiths – “There Is A Light” (partial – start of cassette) Bumper: WRFT – Marc’s Melody Shack (Elvis Costello “Man Out Of Time Intro” in background) Song: Basia – “Best Friends”   Talk: Songs Played, Show Welcome, WRFT Playhouse at 11 AM “Often Spoken, Seldom Felt” Song: Blue Costello – “Chewing Gum” Song: Mental As Anything – “If You Leave Me Can I Come, Too” Song: Graham Parker – “Slash & Burn” Talk: Songs Played, WRFT Top 10 List in the station, PSA – American Red Cross – Bloodmobile Dates and Locations, Temple Ambler Blood Drive Aggressiveness – Please report them to Steve Gambino Bumper:  WRFT Playhouse Presents – In The Minds Own Words – “Often Spoken, Seldom (Approx 46 minutes) Song: The A’s – “Painting By Numbers” (partial – start of cassette) Song: Robbie Robertson – “Testimony” Song: The Radiators – “Like Dreamers Do” Song: The Blue Nile – “Headlights Romance” (partial – end of cassette)

items.description: Marc’s Melody Shack–WRFT 640/540 AM–Temple University Ambler Campus Radio Hosted by: Marc Norman Arot – Temple University – Ambler Campus – Class of 1990 The Wednesday Night Showcase – From 1985 to 1990 – 2 to 3 Hour show of one artist 1) 04/25/90 – WEDNESDAY NIGHT SHOWCASE – THE “OTHER SIDE” OF BILL JOEL - Tape 1 – Side A (Approx. 32 minutes) Song: The Creatures – “Fury Eyes” (partial – start of cassette) Talk:  Show Welcome, Billy Joel “No Hit” Showcase, 10 albums from Piano Man to Storm Front Album History: “Piano Man” (1973) Song: “Travelin’ Prayer” Song: “Worst Comes To Worst” Song: “Stop In Nevada” Talk: Songs Played, Recap of hits on “Piano Man” LP, Report on Sluggo The Wondercat – hit by car and walked away, keep calls and donations coming in!, WRFT Request Line Info, Next album “Streetlife Serenade” – hits = Entertainer and Root Beer Rag Album History: “Streetlife Serenade” (1974) Song: "Los Angelenos" Song: “Souvenir”  Talk: Songs Played, Next Album = “Turnstiles” Album History – “Turnstiles” (1976) Song: “All You Want To Do Is Dance” Song: “James” Talk: Songs Played, Hits from Turnstiles include, Say Goodbye To Hollywood, Summer Highland Falls, New York State Of Mind, Angry Young Man, Miami 2017, Marc’s Melody Shack show plug, Next LP is The Stranger – all songs but last two were hits Album History – “The Stranger” (1977) Song: “Get It Right The First Time” (partial – end of cassette) 2) 04/25/90 – WEDNESDAY NIGHT SHOWCASE – THE “OTHER SIDE” OF BILL JOEL - Tape 1 – Side B (Approx. 32 minutes) Album History – “The Stranger” (1977) (cont.) Song: “Get It Right The First Time” (partial – start of cassette) Song: “Everybody Has A Dream” Talk: Songs Played, Next LP is 52nd Street, Cueing up the WRFT CD Player, Marc’s Last Show next Wednesday, 52nd Street is Marc’s favorite LP, Hits include Big Shot, Honesty, My Life, Stiletto and Until The Night Album History – “52nd Street” (1978) Song: “Zanzibar” Song: “Rosalinda’s Eyes” Song: “Half A Mile Away” Talk: Songs Played, Glass Houses LP up next, hits include You May Be Right, Sometimes A Fantasy, Don’t Ask Me Why, Still Rock & Roll To Me, and Sleeping With TV On, WRFT Request Line and Donation Line for Sluggo Album History – “Glass Houses” (1980) Song: “All For Leyna” Song: “I Don’t Want To Be Alone” Song: "C'était Toi (You Were the One)" (partial – end of cassette) 3) 04/25/90 – WEDNESDAY NIGHT SHOWCASE – THE “OTHER SIDE” OF BILL JOEL - Tape 2 – Side A (Approx. 30 minutes) Album History – “Glass Houses” (1980) (cont.) Song: "C'était Toi (You Were the One)" (partial – start of cassette) Talk: Songs Played, Billy Sings in French!, Marc’s Melody Shack Show plug, Nylon Curtain Up Next, Billy Joel’s favorite album as a songwriter  Album History – “The Nylon Curtain” (1982) Song: “She’s Right On Time” Song: “Scandinavian Skies” Song: “Laura” Talk: Songs Played, Laura is Marc’s favorite Billy Joel Song, Nylon Curtain Hits Include Allentown, Pressure, Goodnight Saigon, An Innocent Man LP up next, hits include Tell Her About It, Uptown Girl, The Longest Time, Keeping The Faith, An Innocent Man Album History – “An Innocent Man” (1983) Song: “This Night” Song: “Christy Lee” Song: “Easy Money” (partial – end of cassette) 4) 04/25/90 – WEDNESDAY NIGHT SHOWCASE – THE “OTHER SIDE” OF BILL JOEL - Tape 2 – Side B (Approx. 31 minutes)  Album History – “An Innocent Man” (1983) (cont.) Song: “Easy Money” (partial – start of cassette) Talk: Songs Played, Innocent Man LP hits include An Innocent Man Tell Her About It, Uptown Girl, The Longest Time, Keeping The Faith, The Bridge Up Next then Storm Front and a possible bonus song or two, Hits from The Bridge include Matter Of Trust, This Is The Time, Modern Woman (from Ruthless People) and Big Man On Mulberry Street (from Moonlighting) Album History – “The Bridge” (1986) Song: “Running On Ice” (written for movie Hotel Paradise) Song: “Code Of Silence” (with Cyndi Lauper) Song: “Getting Closer” (with Steve Winwood) Talk: Songs Played, Station Record is missing, Storm Front up next – all from CD – will be gaps between tracks, hits include We Didn’t Start The Fire, I Go To Extremes, That’s Not Her Style Album History – “Storm Front” (1989) Song: “Shameless” Song: “And So It Goes” Talk: Songs PlayedDistracting Fan noise,  Temple Ambler Theater Class One Act Plays next Friday Night and Saturday Night in Bright Hall Lounge – features WRFT members Marc Arot, Kenya Williamson, Dave Wolfe, BONUS SONG! From Glass Houses LP (1980), Marc’s Last Show Next Wednesday, Show Sign Off Song: “Through The Long Night” Bumper: WRFT – Marc’s Melody Shack – Wednesday’s from 10 AM to 12 PM (Marc Arot) End Of Wednesday Night Showcase Collection

Talk: Marc’s Final Farewell – My Show Dedicated to that ONE Listener who wanted to hear something different Bumper: WRFT – Marc’s Melody Shack (Elvis Costello “Man Out Of Time Intro” in background) Song #1: The A’s – “Do The Dance” (1982) End Of 1990 Spring Semester AND Marc’s Melody Shack Program on WRFT

items.description: Recorded at one of Marcus Richey’s early “Barn Night,” performance series. These were staged in the barn behind his country home outside of Lawrence, Kansas. subject: Management
Training costs
Officer training
Naval Flight Officer
NFO
Flight training
Marginal cost.
items.description: This study was conducted to determine the marginal cost of training Category I and II Naval Flight Officers. Marginal costs are those costs incurred by training one additional or one less Naval Flight Officer and include under- graduate flight training, permanent change of station, and graduate flight training costs. Category I marginal costs range from $51,244.30 for a P-3 Naval Flight Officer to $309,833.36 for an A-6 Naval Flight Officer. Category II marginal costs range from $24,950.02 for a P-3 Naval Flight Officer to $155,782.71 for an A-6 Naval Flight Officer. An additional study of incremental costs will be required to fully evaluate the financial impact of a large change in the Naval Flight Officer training rate.
items.title: Marginal cost of training a naval flight officer

subject: Financial Management
Officer Training
Military Occupational Specialty 3404
items.description: This thesis evaluates the adequacy of the current training programs provided to Marine Corps financial officers with the primary Military Occupational Specialty (MOS) 3404. Using the responses from a financial training questionnaire which was distributed to Marine financial officers, and interviews with selected senior financial officers. The thesis explores how training programs can be enhanced to best prepare these officers for the 1990's. This research concludes that: (1) Financial officers will need to be versatile to deal with the changing financial systems in the 1990's. (2) The Financial Management Officers Course can be improved by adding a supervisory perspective of disbursing and exposure to the other financial management areas. (3) The Marine Corps Practical Comptrollership Course should be targeted at officers with approximately three years experience and an advanced course should be developed. (4) More intra-MOS training should be encouraged.
items.title: Marine Corps Financial Management Officer training in the 1990's

subject: Marine Corps
Warrant Officer
Restricted Officers
WARRANT
FORCE
APL
DOPMA
WOMA
Marine Corps restructuring
OFMRP
Force structure
items.description: The Marine Corps restricted officer community (Warrant Officers and Limited Duty Officers) has been repeatedly modified throughout its history. The most recent changes include a major restructuring conducted in 1989 and proposed legislation that will create the new grade of Chief Warrant Officer, W5 (CWO-5). This study uses the WARRANT model (A modification of the interactive computer model, FORCE developed at the Naval Postgraduate School) to analyze the effects of these changes. Accessions, promotion rates, and grade distributions are examined for two WO specialties: Personnel Officer (0170) and Aircraft Maintenance Engineer Officer (6004). Data from the 1988 through 1990 Headquarters Marine Corps Master Files were used to estimate model parameters that were utilized to forecast grade distributions for fiscal years 1992, 1996, and 2001. The results suggest that an initial increase in accessions may be required to meet force requirements. Additionally, it appears that promotion opportunities to the senior warrant officer grades may have to be vacancy driven in order to attain the desired pyramid shaped force structure and to meet CWO-5 grade constraints.
items.title: Marine Corps Warrant Officers: a community in turmoil

description: Don't just wish for marketing results—get them! If marketing seems too commercial or too complex, or if your current efforts aren't delivering results, this book is for you. With this helpful guide, you can create a simple, usable marketing plan designed to get results! Since its first edition in 1990, the Marketing Workbook has helped thousands like you use marketing to reach the people you want to help—and attract the money and support your organization deserves. Now, this updated second edition offers an easy-to-follow five-step process to create an effective marketing plan; provides an expanded resources section including Internet examples; and includes ""web wisdom"" to help you set reasonable web goals, build an on-line reputation, and learn about the possibilities and pitfalls of web promotion. Use it to be sure you have the right services to meet people's needs; reach the audiences you want with a message that motivates people to respond; and make a strong impact in your community and beyond. This book will guide you through each stage of the marketing process. You'll learn how to link marketing with strategic planning, set goals and evaluate your success, conduct a marketing audit using the Six Ps of Marketing, position your organization in a unique niche, and develop a marketing plan and promotional campaign. Plus, you also get 27 proven promotional techniques, dozens of tips for writing and design, a sample marketing plan, a case study of how one nonprofit implemented their plan, and much more! Get the Marketing Workbook and start putting the power of marketing to work in your organization!

Salinas River Valley
items.description: The current drought conditions that the Central California coast has been facing and the increasing threat of saltwater intrusion have forced the Salinas Valley to consider alternatives that provide for conserving and allocating limited groundwater resources. Currently, groundwater resources are treated as a common pool resource where there are no clearly defined property rights for groundwater and there is no regulation of use. This thesis examines the question of how to implement a market system for groundwater in the Salinas Valley. The study compares a free-market approach of water allocation to other centralized water management practices. This study found that, in theory, the establishment of clearly defined groundwater rights and a free market system for groundwater would be an efficient method to allocate agricultural groundwater resources.
items.title: Market allocation of agricultural water resources in the Salinas River Valley

description: These issues, and many more, are thoughtfully considered in this meticulously detailed and insightful translation of the original Hebrew text of Jonah as created by Jewish authorities during the second half of the first millennium B.C.E. In these profound and enduring tales, realistic events and miraculous incidents merge, and we never have to wait long to witness the power of God's love or wrath. One of the twelve prophets, Jonah faced more challenges in a short span of time than any other biblical hero. He went to sea and nearly drowned in the belly of a great fish. On land, Jonah journeyed east to Nineveh, where his mission was to spread the word of God in a city plagued by evil. He was tested by God at every tum. But even during his darkest hours, his faith never wavered and through all the tumult, he always listened for the comforting voice of the Lord Author Jack M. Sasson employs the very latest information in biblical scholarship to interpret the many nuances in Jonah's seemingly simple story. Providing Greek, Hebrew, Latin, Aramaic, and, occasionally, Syriac and Arabic translations, this work is an exciting addition to the world-acclaimed Anchor Bible commentaries

The text of Jonah -- The present translation of Jonah -- Jonah among the "twelve prophets" -- The composition of Jonah -- Dating the composition of Jonah -- Liturgical use of Jonah -- Notes and comments -- The setting -- The storm-tossed ship -- The singling out of Jonah -- Obstinancy and submission -- In the fish's belly -- A canticle from the depths -- On dy land -- In Nineveh -- Changes of heart, change of mind -- Move/countermove -- Heat and light -- Interpretations -- Jonah as history or fiction -- Narrative art and literary typology in Jonah -- Looking ahead
items.title: Jonah : a new translation with introduction, commentary, and interpretation

description: More than just the story of a literary career, Mark Twain's Own Autobiography is securely anchored in the writer's relation to his family. His memories of his beloved wife Livy and daughter Susy -- what they meant to him as a husband, a father, and an artist -- constitute a poignant self-portrait. At the same time, this text draws on Twain's immense autobiographical writings for some of his best comic anecdotes, such as those that recall his rambunctious boyhood in Hannibal, his misadventures in the Nevada territory, and his notorious Whittier birthday speech
Originally published in book form under title: Mark Twain's autobiography. 1924

Supervillains
Superheroes
description: "Once upon a time, he was simply Norrin Radd, a restless soul adrift amid the blissful tranquility that was the planet Zenn-La. Not ever the all-consuming love of the beautiful Shalla-Bal could stir his soul sufficiently to provide an escape from his never ending boredom. But the day the world devouring entity known only as Galactus set foot upon Zenn-La, Norrin Radd's life was changed forever. Galactus means doom. For Galactus to live, planets must die. Only life-sustaining planets could possibly provide Galactus nourishment. Of all Zenn-La's citizens, only Norrin Radd chose to defy Galactus, risking everything to save his hapless home world. A bargain was struck, Zenn-La was saved. And thus Norrin Radd became the Silver Surfer, a cosmic powered herald, a seeker of new worlds, worlds without life, yet suitable to sate the horrendous hunger of Galactus. The Silver Surfer won his freedom from Galactus when he once again risked everything to save a populated planet from certain destruction. He defied Galactus and won. The planet he saved was Earth. Now a new and perhaps deadlier threat has arrived. The X-Men, Avengers, the Fantastic Four and all the rest of Earth's mightiest defenders have fallen before the unimaginable power of Mrrungo-Mu's awesome spacecraft, the people of Earth are on the brink of becoming fuel. Can even the Silver Surfer save Earth after every other superhero has failed? And can he resist the fatal charms of Mrrungo-Mu's mistress, the lovely Lady Tnneya, who has the power to convince the Surfer that she is his true love, Shalla-Bal?"--Book jacket
items.title: Marvel Comics presents the enslavers

description: "In this provocative book, Alistair Kee argues that while liberation theology has been regarded as exotic, innovative and dangerous because of its commitment to Marx, the reverse is the truth. Its failure stems from its lack of commitment to Marx and a reluctance to apply his philosophy to the contemporary situation."--Back cover

Part one : Marx's criticisms of religion -- Marx and faith -- Religion as reconciliation -- Religion as reversal -- Religion as ideology -- Historical materialism as religion -- Part two : Marx and liberation theology -- Redemption and revolution -- The influence of Marx on liberation theology -- The use of Marx in liberation theology -- Marxist liberation theology -- Evaluation of Marx in liberation theology -- Part three : beyond liberation theology -- Marx and the failure of liberation theology -- Religion in the next epoch

Canon Law
Catholicism
items.description: This is part of the Mary A. Dooley Lecture Series in Religious Studies, which were held by Elms College (aka The College of Our Lady of the Elms) in Chicopee, Massachusetts. The lecture series began in 1986 with the topic of Vatican II: Twenty Years Later. Sr. Mary A. Dooley was the sixth President of Elms College, serving in that capacity from 1979-1994. The lecture series topic for 1990-1991 was Envisioning the Church of Tomorrow, Today. This particular lecture, by Most Reverend Thomas Dupre (Thomas Ludger Dupre), who was the Auxiliary Bishop of Springfield (Diocese of Springfield, Massachusetts), was held on December 3, 1990. Its title was Freedom Through Law: Pastoral Implications of Canon Law. Dupre later served as Bishop of Springfield from 1995 to 2004. On September 24, 2004, he became the first Catholic bishop ever to be indicted for sexual abuse. However, the Springfield district attorney's office was forced to drop the charges because the statute of limitations had run out.
items.title: Mary A. Dooley Lecture, Most Rev. Thomas Dupre, 1990

Mary Washington College
Universities and colleges -- Curricula -- Catalogs
Universities and colleges -- Virginia -- Fredericksburg -- Catalogs
items.description: This is the official academic course catalog of the University of Mary Washington. First published in 1911 as the Bulletin of the State Normal and Industrial School for Women, this publication provides lists of faculty, course descriptions, photographs of the college, and other information relevant to specified academic terms. Due to the fragile condition of the earliest volumes, the digitization of this publication begins with the State Summer School and School of Elementary Methods catalog (July, 1913). The academic catalogs continue to undergo title changes over the years, reflecting the growth of the University. The catalog title changes to the Bulletin of the State Normal School, Fredericksburg, Virginia (June, 1915), Bulletin: State Teachers College, Fredericksburg, Virginia (April, 1924), Bulletin, Mary Washington College (January, 1938), Bulletin, Mary Washington College of the University of Virginia (January, 1944), Mary Washington College, Academic Catalog/Bulletin (June, 1972), and the University of Mary Washington Academic Catalog (2005-2007). Academic catalogs for the University’s graduate programs were first published in the 2000-2001 academic year.
items.title: Mary Washington College, Summer Session, Summer, 1990

items.description: This is the official alumni magazine of the University of Mary Washington. First published in 1939 as Alumnae News, the magazine continues to highlight alumni and current events at Mary Washington. With the December, 1969 edition of Alumnae News, the newsletter portion became a separately published supplement to the magazine, the Mary Washington College Bulletin. The magazine continued to undergo name changes, as it became MWC Today (February, 1972), Mary Washington College Today (Winter, 1987), University of Mary Washington Today (Winter, 2005), and the University of Mary Washington Magazine (Summer, 2008). There were no issues published between 1957 and 1960.
items.title: Mary Washington College Today, 1990 (Summer)

items.description: Масенко Л. Т. Українські імена і прізвища.—. К.: Т-во «Знання» УРСР, 1990.—48 с.— (Сер. 6 «Духовний світ людини»; № 3). Історія виникнення і побутування імен та прізвищ тісно пов’язана з історією народу, з особливостями його матеріальної і духовної культури. У брошурі розглядається походження українських імен і прізвищ, історичні етапи становлення прізвищ, роль народних говірок у формуванні цієї лексичної групи. Висвітлюються питання правопису імен і прізвищ у сучасній українській мові. Розрахована на лекторів, пропагандистів, викладачів вузів, вчителів, студентів філологічних факультетів, широке коло читачів. Зміст : «Що в імені твоїм...» ... 4 По імені називають, по батькові величають ... 15 Що значить прізвище ... 20 Народні найменування заміжніх жінок ... 40 Деякі зауваження з приводу правопису прізвищ ... 42
items.title: Українські імена і прізвища

items.description: [STREAMING ITA] Rogue One: A Star Wars Story CLICCA QUI ~> http://decinemax.com/movie/330459/rogue-one-a-star-wars-story.html CLICCA QUI ~> http://decinemax.com/movie/330459/rogue-one-a-star-wars-story.html Rogue One: A Star Wars Story In una ventina di minuti di estratto, una lunga clip che mostra l'incontro tra i due protagonisti del film, ovvero Wolverine e la bambina mutante, è subito chiaro cosa Rogue One: A Star Wars Story voglia essere. Nel prossimo futuro, un esausto Logan si prende cura di un malato Professor X in un nascondiglio al confine con il Messico. Ma i tentativi di Logan di nascondersi dal mondo e dalla sua ereditÃ si rivelano inutili quando incontra una giovane mutante, inseguita da forze oscure. In the near future, a weary Logan cares for an ailing Professor X in a hide out on the Mexican border. But Logan's attempts to hide from the world and his legacy are up-ended when a young mutant arrives, being pursued by dark forces. items.description: A hazai fanzinkultúra legnagyobb hatású, aktivitása során legtöbb tartalmat felvonultató, legjobb perspektívát nyújtó és legigényesebben megírt periodikája a Rácz (Mis) Mihály által vitt  Második Látás . Ugyan a Látás jelentős volt a pre-internet időszakban az ipari zenével kapcsolatos információk terjesztésében (ideértve a rokonítható ambienteket, zajzenéket vagy rituális zenei anyagokat), legalább ilyen lelkiismeretesen számolt be a droneos-gitáros-punk-alternatív zúzásokkal vagy későbbi számaiban már a dubkultúrával kapcsolatban. Mis röviden tudott úgy recenziót írni, hogy a lemez jellege és érzete az emberrel maradt, ha a recenzió megtetszett, biztosak lehettünk abban, hogy az albumot is ronggyá fogjuk hallgatni. A tizenegy évet és tizenhat számot megért fanzin 1995-ben egy kiadványba olvadt a Vizler Tibor által készített  Straight Edge  fanzinnal, amellyel hasonló zenei közegekben mozogtak, enyhén más megközelítéssel. Az ML13/SE6 kiadvány majd az ezt követő három közös, soron következő zine megjelenése a hazai fanzinélet legjobb kiadványai között tarthatjó számon. Ennél több a  fanzin.blog.hu idevágó oldalán olvasható , illetve  a Wanted Missel készített podcastjében hallható . Második Látás (Second Sight) was the periodical of the Hungarian fanzine subculture with the greatest impact, during its activity the most content, the best perspective and the most sophisticated writing, released by Mihály "Mis" Rácz. Although Második Látás was significant in the pre-Internet period for the dissemination of information about industrial music (with the related ambient, noise or ritual music subgenres), it reported at least as conscientiously about droney-guitarish-punk-alternative punches or even dub in its later issues. Mis had the grandiose skill of being able to write a short review in such a way so that the character and the vibe of the record stayed with you - if you fancied the review, you could be a 100% sure you gonna spin the album until forever. The zine, spanning 11 years and 16 issues, merged into one volume of publication in 1995 with Tibor Vizler's Straight Edge fanzine - they both shared a similar music taste, with a slightly different approach. The publication ML13/SE6 and its three subsequent joint zines are among the best publications of the Hungarian fanzine scene. You can read more about this zine  on the relevant page of fanzin.blog.hu  or listen to  the Wanted music podcast with Mis being interviewed  (in Hungarian only). A tartalomból/Contents: Hajnóczy Csaba Trottel Center Za Dehumanizacijo Noise Gate Watch You Drown Ápolók Sleeping Dogs Wake Zajártalom Év Swans Cassandra Complex Lemezkritikák (Music reviews)

items.description: The catalogs show the evolution of the institution's curriculum, reuirements, staff, and facilities from its founding as the Mass. Normal Art School in 1873.; As Mass. College of Art, the school broadened its focus from training art teachers to also training artists and designers, courses became more specialized, programs became longer, and degrees began to be offered. The catalogs contain a mission statement, a statement of purpose, and academic calendar, location information, admission requirements and conditions, information on tuition and financial aid, academic policies, program descriptions and requirements for completion, course listings and descriptions, lists of administrators, faculty, trustees, and members of the state board overseeing public higher education, and an application for admission.; The 1913 Catalog contains lists of positions filled by graduates and past pupils of the institution. Many later catalogs contain photographs of students and students' work. The various titles of this publication have been Circular, Circular and Catalogue, Catalogue, Catalog, and Bulletin.; Supplements issued for (1926-27) - (1932-33); (1954); (1958-59); (1963-64); (1967); (1982-83)-(1983-84); (1986); (2008); (2010); and (2011). Also, (1946-47) issued with original artwork color prints, and (1994) supplement "picture book".; In Reference, 1873/74 to 1997 (originals and photocopies) in 7 spiral bound vols. (29 cm.). Also seven bound volumes of 1877-1884,1884-1891, 1892-1898, 1899-1904, 1904-1908, 1908-1913, 1913-1916 are cataloged in the Archives.
items.title: Massachusetts College of Art catalog

description: Introduction -- Driving safely -- Transporting cargo safely -- Transporting passengers -- Air brakes -- Combination vehicles -- Hazardous materials

Recognizing that professional drivers need specialized skills to operate large commercial vehicles and the often sensitive loads they carry, the United States Congress has mandated uniform national standards for knowledge and skills testing through the Commercial Driver License Law (CDL).... This manual has been designed to help truck and bus drivers prepare for both the knowledge and behind the wheel tests for commercial licenses. Consistent with the intent of the CDL program, it is also intended, in a practical way, to assist commercial drivers with acquiring and refining the tools necessary to assure their safety and the safety of all highway users. -A message for commercial drivers
